docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 29 (AP) -- Stock exchange officials of seven American countries today urged their Government to "assure absolute freedom for financial operations as soon as possible."
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Oct. 29 (AP) -- Stock exchange officials of seven American countries today urged their Government to "assure absolute freedom for financial operations as soon as possible."
docs.abstract: F A Truslow opposes barter trade trend; sees possible end of private trade

headline.main: For Financial Freedom; ARGENTINES LEAVE BROKERS' SESSION

docs.snippet: United States announcement of "notice of intent" to negotiate new trade agreements with eleven countries and issuance of the "bargaining" list of commodities for proposed tariff cuts is expected soon in foreign-trade circles here. It would not be...
docs.lead_paragraph: United States announcement of "notice of intent" to negotiate new trade agreements with eleven countries and issuance of the "bargaining" list of commodities for proposed tariff cuts is expected soon in foreign-trade circles here. It would not be surprising, it was said, if both announcements were made immediately after election day, and certainly within the next ten days.
docs.abstract: Govt seen set to list proposed tariff cuts

headline.main: ACTION IS AWAITED ON TRADING PACTS; Announcement of Negotiations With 11 Foreign Countries Expected After Election

docs.snippet: There were some interesting price changes in the foreign-exchange market last week which were in the main only reflecting special conditions and not at all symptomatic of general unsteadiness. There was the sudden break in the pound sterling; a...
docs.lead_paragraph: There were some interesting price changes in the foreign-exchange market last week which were in the main only reflecting special conditions and not at all symptomatic of general unsteadiness. There was the sudden break in the pound sterling; a softer tone in the Canadian free dollar and a sharp decline in the Swiss free franc.

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Nov. 4 -- Trade agreements between the bizonal area and Uruguay and Egypt, calling for the exchange of approximately $60,000,000 worth of goods, have been approved by Generals Lucius D. Clay and Sir Brian Robertson, United States and British...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Nov. 4 -- Trade agreements between the bizonal area and Uruguay and Egypt, calling for the exchange of approximately $60,000,000 worth of goods, have been approved by Generals Lucius D. Clay and Sir Brian Robertson, United States and British Military Governors.

headline.main: TRADE PACTS APPROVED; Bizonal Area to Exchange Goods With Egypt and Uruguay

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 -- The Interdepartmental Trade Agreements Committee today issued formal notice of the intention of the United States to participate in negotiations with eleven countries for reciprocal reduction of tariff and other trade barriers...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 -- The Interdepartmental Trade Agreements Committee today issued formal notice of the intention of the United States to participate in negotiations with eleven countries for reciprocal reduction of tariff and other trade barriers looking to their accession to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade concluded at Geneva on Oct. 30, 1947, by the United States and twenty-two other countries.
docs.abstract: Interdepartmental Trade Agreements Com sets reciprocal pact talks with 11 nations on their accession to Geneva pact terms; Tariff Comm role noted

headline.main: NOTICE FILED BY U.S. ON TARIFF HEARINGS

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The unexpected result of Tuesday's balloting brought but minor disturbance in the foreign exchange market last week. It appeared only to affect the Swiss free franc; pound sterling was steady and the Canadian free dollar turned up at the close from...
docs.lead_paragraph: The unexpected result of Tuesday's balloting brought but minor disturbance in the foreign exchange market last week. It appeared only to affect the Swiss free franc; pound sterling was steady and the Canadian free dollar turned up at the close from mid-week heaviness.

docs.snippet: An expanded recovery program for Japan, to enable that country to pay its own way, was urged yesterday by William H. Draper Jr., Under-Secretary of the Army.
docs.lead_paragraph: An expanded recovery program for Japan, to enable that country to pay its own way, was urged yesterday by William H. Draper Jr., Under-Secretary of the Army.

headline.main: AID TO JAPAN ASKED IN PAYING OWN WAY; Draper Calls for Expanded Recovery Program and Big Rise in Export Trade ITO CALLED 'SUPER STATE' McCaffrey Tells Council Unit Is World Bureaucracy -- ECA Chief May Go to Korea URGES AIDING JAPAN PAY ITS OWN WAY

docs.snippet: PARIS, Nov. 10 -- The Legal Committee of the United Nations General Assembly voted today to give state courts rather than an international tribunal the power to try any persons accused of the crime of mass extermination, a decision believed by many...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 10 -- The Legal Committee of the United Nations General Assembly voted today to give state courts rather than an international tribunal the power to try any persons accused of the crime of mass extermination, a decision believed by many here to sound the death knell for the proposed international pact on genocide.
docs.abstract: com rejects conv clause giving trial powers to internatl rather than to state cts; some delegations reactions

headline.main: KEY VOTE PERILS PACT ON GENOCIDE; U.N. Committee Rejects Clause Giving Powers of Trial to a World Tribunal
